column6: Understanding role of microbial agents in health and disease
Understanding of immunological mechanisms in health and disease
Correlating natural history, mechanisms and clinical manifestations of infectious diseases
Knowledge of principles and application of infection control measures
Understanding of laboratory diagnostic tests, interpretation, and antimicrobial therapy
Knowledge of outbreak investigation and control
Explain how different microorganisms cause human infection
Understand commensal, opportunistic and pathogenic organisms
Describe characteristics (morphology, resistance, virulence) of microorganisms
Explain host defense mechanisms against microorganisms
Describe laboratory diagnosis of human infections
Plan laboratory investigations for diagnosis of infectious diseases
Perform and interpret immunological and serological tests
Operate routine and sophisticated laboratory instruments
